name: Smokey Bastard: Sounds a bit like 'bum' T-shirt
description:
The Smokey Bastard Mint present for your consideration this delightfully tasteful heirloom T-shirt, forged in finest Gildan heavy cotton with artist Tom Mcgrath's timeless design rendered in finest quality white paint. 

For a paltry one-time investment of 7.99 plus p&p, you and all future generations sired by you can enjoy these elegant, forensically detailed and fully annotated line drawings of a mandolin, banjo and accordion. Not just a family treasure, this heirloom-style shirt also acts as an educational aid, allowing the owner to correctly identify shafts, knobs and f-holes when in the presence of musicians. With utility and beauty manifested in such immaculate balance, can you really afford not to buy one?

name: Smokey Bastard 'Corporal Pork Chop' T-Shirt
description:
Available in Gildan Heavy and Ladies fitted soft style. Sizes from small to XXL in regular and small to XL in ladies fit. Available in black only.  

We're sorry but we are temporarily out of stock of regular medium T-shirts.

name: 'Tales from the Wasteland' CD album
description: The award winning second album from Smokey Bastard, in a beautiful 6 panel fold out digipack. Please note this album is not available on this site but can be purchased from the Bomber Music store here. 1 Wasteland 2 Token Folkin 3 Eden Holme (Pt I) 4 Mongrel 5 My Son John 6 Mong Some Hoof 7 Yuppie Dracula 8 Boatepitaph (Pt II) 9 Cheer Up, Love (Worse Things Happen At Sea) (Pt III) 10 Aspirations, I Have Some 11 Dear Mol 12 Bad Reception 13 Mamma Mia

name: 'Propping Up The Floor' CD Album
description: 2010 self released debut album. New album 'Tales From The Wasteland' available here Track listing: 01: The Last Blackwall 02: Curse the London City Gent 03: The Auld Triangle 04: Steve the Twat 05: I'll Tell Me Ma 06: Old Boys' State 07: Sprocket 08: Weigh Anchor 09: Boys Who Left the Band 10: The Cumberland Crew 11: Drunken Sailor 12: Old Jack
